intro: Anneslia coulteri, commonly known as Coulter's anneslia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stem. Anneslia coulteri is often found in open woodlands and canyons, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
